eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * (1 - speed)^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln((1 - speed)))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

parameters: TargetedRotationAngle + 90 + RotationAngleOffset + AngleDifference(CameraAngle(Object.Layer()), TargetedRotationAngle + 90 + RotationAngleOffset) * exp(TimeDelta() * RotationLogSpeed)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteMultitouchJoystick
description: Multitouch joysticks are objects showing a joystick on the screen, useful for mobile. They work like a physical gamepad:

- Automatic "mapper" behaviors for 2D and 3D movement behaviors (platformer characters, top-down movement, 3D character etc...). Add one of these to the object with the movement behavior (i.e: the player most of the time) and the behavior will then be controlled automatically by the virtual joystick (it works by reading the multitouch joystick state and simulating controls). No need for additional events to make it work once the behaviors are set up.
There are ready-to-use joysticks in the asset-store [multitouch joysticks pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=multitouch-joysticks-multitouch-joysticks).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: PANDAKO-GitHub
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MousePointerLock
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This behavior removes the limit on the distance the mouse can move and hides the cursor.
description: This behavior removes the limit on the distance the mouse can move and hides the cursor.
For example, a user can rotate or continue to manipulate an object by moving the mouse endlessly ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://mouse-pointer-lock)).
Without the pointer lock, the rotation or operation will stop the moment the pointer reaches the edge of the browser or screen.
Game players don't have to worry about leaving the gameplay area or accidentally clicking on another application that moves the mouse focus away from the game.
Locking the pointer locks `CursorX()` and `CursorY()` expressions.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteToggleSwitch
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Toggle switch that users can click or touch.
description: Toggle switch that users can click or touch. The switch can be customized with sprites.
There are ready-to-use toggle switches in the asset-store [settings UI pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=settings-ui-settings-ui).

changelog.breaking: - Toggle switches now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing toggle switches in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the events are running for the editor.
eventsFunctions.name: IsInGameEdition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Events are running for the editor

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the switch object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SwitchFSM

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the toggle switch is checked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsChecked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the toggle switch was checked in the current frame.
eventsFunctions.name: HasJustBeenChecked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the toggle switch was unchecked in the current frame.
eventsFunctions.name: HasJustBeenUnchecked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the toggle switch was toggled in the current frame.
eventsFunctions.name: HasJustBeenToggled

eventsFunctions.description: Check (or uncheck) the toggle switch.
eventsFunctions.name: SetChecked

events.comment: Avoid a started touch to interfere with a state change from events.

eventsFunctions.description: Toggle the switch.
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleChecked

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A toggle switch that users can click or touch.
eventsBasedObjects.name: SpriteToggleSwitch

events.comment:
Pass the configuration to the behavior.
The PreviousIsChecked property allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.

propertyDescriptors.description: It's used to detect a change at hot reload.
